intro: Andrachne hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of pink or white flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
